meanings.definition: The ability to be stretched or extended without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The tensility of the rubber band allowed it to stretch far without snapping.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's tensility made it perfect for yoga pants that needed to move with the body.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's tensility was put to the test when it was blown up to its limit.
meanings.sent4: Her patience had the tensility of a rubber band, always able to handle more without breaking.
meanings.sent5: The tree branch showed incredible tensility as it swayed in the wind without snapping.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily stretched or bent.
meanings.sent1: The tensility of the dough made it easy to shape into different forms.
meanings.sent2: The plastic ruler's tensility allowed it to bend without breaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity led to a comical display of tensility as it tried to fit into a small box.
meanings.sent4: His mind had the tensility of a rubber band, always open to new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's body showed impressive tensility as she gracefully moved through each pose.
